Posts.Content: I also have a giant 3 ring binder for my husband's five years of prostate cancer. The doctors do share digital info but I keep this paper version updated more for our two sons who may not have access years from now. Prostate cancer has a genetic component (& so do many other cancers/diseases) and I want them to have his history for their health too. It does give me a sense that I am able to "do something" for my husband's health by maintaining this record. There were times in the beginning that the mindless effort of sorting and hole-punching papers brought me a lot of comfort as I tried to learn all the abbreviations & terms!
Posts.Title: Mastering your medical paperwork: Tips from a professional organizer
